poem:
**Duet**

Keys in unison,  
a gentle press of history  
whispers Schubert—  
two hearts,  
one breathless Fantasie.  
From Russia,  
from the steppe,  
fingers weave silk through air—  
a harmony of origins.  
Notes pirouette,  
falling through time  
like we,  
holding this moment  
in finite F minor.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Kolesnikov/Tsoy: Franz Schubert/Leonid Desyatnikov review – a piano duo of rare intimacy Partners on stage and off, as well as solo artists, Russian-born Pavel Kolesnikov and Kazakhstan-born Samson Tsoy have played as a piano duo since their student days over a decade ago (they are in their mid 30s). In their first joint disc for Harmonia Mundi they have built a programme around two Schubert masterpieces of the genre: the Fantasie in F minor D940". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Kolesnikov/Tsoy: Franz Schubert/Leonid Desyatnikov review – a piano duo of rare intimacy Partners on stage and off, as well as solo artists, Russian-born Pavel Kolesnikov and Kazakhstan-born Samson Tsoy have played as a piano duo since their student days over a decade ago (they are in their mid 30s). In their first joint disc for Harmonia Mundi they have built a programme around two Schubert masterpieces of the genre: the Fantasie in F minor D940
